decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to utilize Underworld Breach as the key engine. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station are key pieces that help to mill the opponent's library, while Mishra's Bauble and Malevolent Rumble provide additional support. The deck also includes control elements like Swan Song and Lightning Bolt to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Urza's Saga and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to find key cards, while Thassa's Oracle serves as a win condition once the combo is assembled. The deck aims to efficiently combo off and win the game before the opponent can respond.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, generating infinite mana with Mox Opal and Grinding Station to win the game. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and enable Breach combos. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces and protection, while Urza's Saga can tutor for key artifacts. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Spell Snare, Swan Song, and Unholy Heat to interact with the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm opponents.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. It utilizes cards like Arid Mesa and Sacred Foundry to quickly get the right mana needed for powerful spells like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment. The strategy is to play multiple threats early on and pressure the opponent into making unfavorable trades while also having access to removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Static Prison to control the board. The goal is to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize their defenses.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and give your lands haste, allowing you to ramp quickly into powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By using lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber to untap and bounce lands, you can generate massive amounts of mana and search for key lands like Vesuva and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to close out the game with a devastating combo finish. The deck aims to assemble its key pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful land synergies.

This deck aims to control the game by ramping up mana with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return help control the board, while cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Writhing Chrysalis provide value and disruption. The deck also has versatile spells like Kozilek's Command for additional removal and utility. Overall, the strategy revolves around ramping into big Eldrazi threats and using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a landless combo strategy focused on controlling the game and disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal while generating mana and card advantage from non-land sources. The deck aims to consistently assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game quickly, leveraging cards like Goblin Charbelcher, Lotus Bloom, and Thundertrap Trainer to create powerful plays. It also includes a variety of disruptive elements like Suppression Ray and Sink into Stupor to slow down opponents and protect its own game plan.

This deck focuses on using the combo of Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to quickly mill the opponent's deck and win the game. By constantly recurring artifacts from the graveyard with Underworld Breach and Emry's ability, players can trigger Grinding Station's ability multiple times in a turn to mill large portions of the opponent's deck. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mishra's Bauble provide additional card draw to find the combo pieces quickly, while disruption cards like Swan Song and Lightning Bolt help protect the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to create a disruptive and aggressive strategy by utilizing creatures that have powerful abilities when they enter the battlefield or leave it. By combining cards like Ephemerate, Aether Vial, and Flickerwisp, the deck aims to control the opponent's board while deploying threats of its own. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong aggressive presence on the battlefield.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Blood Moon and Surgical Extraction. The creatures in the deck are efficient and can quickly apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also has some control elements like Mana Tithe and Ranger-Captain of Eos to protect its threats. Overall, the deck focuses on fast and efficient plays to quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to play efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also using spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to chip away at the opponent's life total. Cards like Searing Blaze and Skullcrack are also included to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from stabilizing. By applying constant pressure and forcing the opponent to react, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and ultimately winning with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also includes cards for card advantage and deck manipulation, such as Opt and Brainsurge. The land base is designed to support the control elements of the deck, with access to different colored sources and utility lands like Field of Ruin. By managing resources effectively, the deck aims to outlast opponents and dominate the game.
